skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, and viewing browser logs.
skill.summary: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying...

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with minimal audit required. No security issues identified in the reviewed files.

content.value_statement: Testing local web apps can be slow and inconsistent. This skill provides Playwright patterns and server helpers to script reliable checks and capture evidence.
actual_capabilities: Run Playwright scripts against local servers
Wait for network idle before inspecting dynamic pages
Capture full page screenshots during runs
Collect browser console logs for debugging
Discover buttons, links, and inputs on a page
Launch and stop one or more servers before tests
limitations: Requires Python and Playwright installed locally
Targets localhost or file URLs, not remote auth flows
Server readiness checks rely on open ports

use_cases.title: UI smoke checks
use_cases.description: Run quick Playwright flows after changes to verify key pages load and buttons respond.

use_cases.title: Console error capture
use_cases.description: Collect console logs during user flows to report regressions with clear evidence.

use_cases.title: Learn browser automation
use_cases.description: Follow simple scripts to practice selectors, waits, and screenshots on local HTML files.

prompt_templates.title: Open and screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Playwright script that opens a local HTML file and takes a full page screenshot.

prompt_templates.title: Find page elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a script to list visible buttons, links, and inputs on http://localhost:5173 after waiting for network idle.

prompt_templates.title: Capture console logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a script that records console messages while clicking the Dashboard link, then saves logs to a file.

prompt_templates.title: Run with servers
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to start backend and frontend servers with with_server.py and run a Playwright test once both are ready.

output_examples.input: List the first five links on my local app and save a screenshot.
output: First links: Home, Dashboard, Settings, Help, Logout

best_practices: Wait for network idle before inspecting dynamic pages
Use clear selectors like role or text when possible
Always close the browser to avoid orphaned processes
anti_patterns: Inspect the DOM before the page finishes loading
Hardcode sleeps instead of waiting for selectors
Start servers manually when with_server.py can manage them

faq.question: What environments does this support?
faq.answer: It targets local servers or file URLs and uses Python Playwright with Chromium.

faq.question: Are there limits on page types?
faq.answer: It does not handle complex remote auth or cloud hosted apps by default.

faq.question: Can I integrate with my dev server?
faq.answer: Yes, use with_server.py to start one or more servers before running tests.

faq.question: Does it send data outside my machine?
faq.answer: No, the scripts run locally and store outputs on your filesystem.

faq.question: What if the server is not ready?
faq.answer: Increase the timeout or verify the server port matches the command.

faq.question: How does it compare to raw Playwright usage?
faq.answer: It adds ready made patterns and a server runner to reduce setup work.
